_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:36:00 using v2.5
title: How has life expectancy changed by country?
analysis_commentary:
The graph compares life expectancy rates for the UK with selected other countries over the last 30 year. Life expectancy has increased in all countries over this time period with the UK's life expectancy having increased by 7 years from 74.1 in 1982 to 81.1 in 2012.

In 2012, Japan had the highest life expectancy in the world at 83.2 years and the Mexico had consitently the lowest since 2000 - it was 74.4 years in 2012. Despite longer term increases, in 2012, the UK was roughly in the middle of the countries included. In 2012, UK life expectency was 81.0 years, which matched the average of those countries included. From 1982 to 2011, the UK has increased it's life expectancy every year - however in 2012 this did not improve and remained at 81.0 years as seen in 2011.
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Statistics 2014
